title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct answer and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Disagree. According to Le Châtelier’s principle, the distribution of species will shift towards reactants when the temperature is decreased in an endothermic reaction. Therefore, the mole fraction of Cl 2 O MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C6D@ will decrease, not increase.

The response provides both the correct answer and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

title: Part H
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct answer and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Cl 2 (g) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DE7@ is more likely to deviate from the ideal gas law. Cl 2 (g) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DE7@ molecules have larger and more polarizable electron clouds than O 2 (g) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D04@ . Therefore, Cl 2 (g) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DE7@ has stronger overall intermolecular forces.

The response provides both the correct answer and a valid justification equivalent to the following.
